greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Perrin sequence of order 5.
comment: If p is prime, p divides a(p).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (terms 0..1000 from T. D. Noe)
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,0,0,1,1).
formula: a(n) = (x_1)^n + (x_2)^n + (x_3)^n + (x_4)^n + (x_5)^n where (x_i) 1 <= i <= 5 are the roots of x^5=x+1.
a(0) = 5 and a(n) = n*Sum_{k=1..floor(n/4)} binomial(k,n-4*k)/k for n > 0. - _Seiichi Manyama_, Mar 04 2019
a((s+5)*n + m) = Sum_{j=0..n} binomial(n-j,j)*a(s*n+j+m) for all s > 0, m > 0.
maple: seq(coeff(series((x^4-5)/(x^5+x^4-1),x,n+1), x, n), n = 0 .. 60); # _Muniru A Asiru_, Mar 06 2019
program: (GAP) a:=[5,0,0,0,4];; for n in [6..60] do a[n]:=a[n-4]+a[n-5]; od; Print(a); # _Muniru A Asiru_, Mar 06 2019
(MAGMA) I:=[5,0,0,0,4]; [n le 5 select I[n] else Self(n-4) +Self(n-5): n in [1..60]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 06 2019
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Oct 27 2003
